divs: sighting detailswhile serving in the army (at the time 3\187 inf. of the 101st airborne division), i was participating in a field exercise in the "back 40" of ft. campbell kentucky. during the evening hours my platoon rotated through a two man guard routine during the evening hours. one guard was mobile and walking the perimiter of our area, the other was to man the m60 machine gun mounted on top of a 5-ton transport truck. the truck was positioned as such that it was facing an open area about the size of a football field, but oval in shape. the duty of the gunner was to maintain the security of this open area. as such, one has to be vigilant of all motion in this area. due to the amount of light and our operating procedure, it was necessary to be wearing our pvs-7b night vision goggles. during my shift as gunner i saw a saucer shaped craft emerge from over the tops of the trees at about a 2 o'clock from my position. it moved in a semicircle until it was hovering over the cleared area to my front. during the time of it's hover, i can only estimate that the craft was no more than 100ft off of the ground. there was no question in my mind that this was a u.f.o. i have researched since that time and have not found any other situations with the same exact circumstances. by this i mean that, as usual the craft emitted no sound, but there were also no lights coming from the craft either. if i had not been wearing my night vision goggles i am sure that i would not have seen the craft at all. the craft was distinctly saucer shaped, but the bottom was concave in it's center, as if hollowed out partially. after hovering in dead silence for about 10 seconds it retreated directly away from my position in a seemingly straight line, until it finally was out of site past the tree line to my front. i had always believed that u.f.o.'s existed, and had seen the odd light in the sky, but this was very close and to this day the memory is vivid and i am completely certain of what i saw that evening.
